channel.title: Need help with portforwarding
channel.description:
ive tried atleast 20 guides on how to make a private server. i finaly made one after about 3 months of trying, but when i run it it works fine for me but no-one else can connect ive been through my portforward settings and as far as i know they look like its right and i set up my firewall aswell maybe someone could help me? maybe use teamviewer and connect to my computer and do it for me? i dont mean to be lazy but a lot of guides ive looked at dont help me to much and im pullign my hair out over this. many thanks in advance.
haha dumball :D

item.title: Need help with portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @haha_dumball haha dumball
item.description:
@haha_dumball wrote:

ye in no-ip duc my ip is there i knew there was something wrong with portforward just wasnt sure what. any chance you could say a little on how i add it to outgoing? if its not too much trouble itf it is then ill just have 2 stop being lazy and work it out.

edit: just looked and it says outbound and its the same as my inbound so im gona guess that its set up for inbound and outbound

Read full topic

mm u need to port forward mean u put port 43594 in outoign and ingoing. and ya in no-ip duc

{out=43594}
{in=43594}

in the ports section?[/quote]

on my router i went onto firewall rules and added a new rule

heres what ive put
and i use no-ip duc aswell
